revised_title: The Structure and Function of Gastric Gland Pigments in Mollusca and Decapod Crustacea
tldr: The author investigates the structure and function of the gastric gland in mollusca and decapod crustacea, focusing on the pigment enterochlorophyll. They find that the pigment is a chlorophyll derivative, primarily taken up from the intestine and deposited in the gastric gland. The author also discusses the excretion process and the role of leucocytes in transporting substances within the gland.
